item.title: ‘Living coral’ is Pantone’s new color of the year - but how is it chosen? - Tri-City Herald
item.description:

Pantone picked living coral as color of the year, a pinkish peachy hue. How do they choose a new trending color each year to predict, why did they choose living ...

item.title: Pantone thinks this color will be your shade in 2019 - CNN
item.description:
Pantone thinks this color will be your shade in 2019  CNN

For more about what happened in 2018 and what's ahead in 2019, go to CNN.com/2018. We had fun with Ultraviolet in 2018, but this year we're ready to move on from the mysteries of the cosmos and dive deep into the ocean. Pantone, the self-proclaimed global authority on color, has declared "Living Coral" the color of the year for 2019. "Just as coral reefs are a source of sustenance and shelter to sea life, vibrant yet mellow, Pantone 16-1546, Living Coral embraces us with warmth and nourishment to provide comfort and buoyancy in our continually shifting environment," Pantone announced Wednes...

item.title: Here’s Pantone’s color of the year — charged with inspiring ‘joyful pursuits’ and, hey, saving our planet - MarketWatch
item.description:
Here’s Pantone’s color of the year — charged with inspiring ‘joyful pursuits’ and, hey, saving our planet  MarketWatch

THE MARGIN By Rachel Koning Beals Living Coral was selected to encourage ‘connection and intimacy’ Pantone You could very well see this warm, lively hue in everything from makeup to Bose speakers to office waiting rooms and food packaging. And you’re meant to smile in its presence. Smile. No matter how gray the political landscape may seem. No matter how urgent the efforts have become to save the very marine ecosystems that inspired this selection. The 2019 color of the year is Pantone 16-1546 Living Coral, an animating shade of orange with a golden undertone, which reflects the warmth, nou...

item.title: Pantone's 2019 Color Of The Year Channels Nature Once Again - Forbes
item.description:
Pantone's 2019 Color Of The Year Channels Nature Once Again  Forbes

Coral is 2019’s color of the year, according to the experts at Pantone , the company best known for providing professional color standards and digital solutions for the design industry. Expect to see coral, a shade of orange with a golden undertone, in everything from kitchen accessories to food and beauty products. Two years ago, Pantone chose Greenery because it signified beginnings, from responding to the growing trends in healthier eating to being outdoors. This past year’s Ultra Violet was a nod to lighting the way to what is yet to come. Representing the fusion of modern life, Pantone...

item.title: Move over millennial pink: Coral is the colour of the year for 2019 - The Independent
item.description:
Move over millennial pink: Coral is the colour of the year for 2019  The Independent

Look out, millennial pink, there's a new colour in town, and its vying to take your crown. The bright hue of coral has been named the 2019 colour of the year, having appeared on the runway, in modern makeup looks and across the media as of late. Every year, design company Pantone decides upon its colour of the year by taking cultural trends into account. Pantone's colour of the year for 2019 is "living coral" (Pantone) Having chosen "ultra violet" as its 2018 colour of the year, describing the shade as "dramatically provocative and thoughtful", the company has decided to go for a more vibra...

item.title: Millennial Pink is dead, and Pantone’s Color of the Year killed it - Fast Company
item.description:
Millennial Pink is dead, and Pantone’s Color of the Year killed it  Fast Company

The reign of Millennial Pink–that literally and figuratively cool hue whose blue undertones flattered no one–seems to be coming to an end at last. In its place? We have Living Coral. It’s Pantone’s Color of the Year for 2019, following the company’s annual, wide-ranging analysis of color trends across culture. Living Coral is comforting and energizing at the same time, a color meant to serve as a salve in a time of global uncertainty. [Image: Pantone] “Just as coral reefs are a source of sustenance and shelter, we see this color giving us assurance and buoyancy in an environment that’s been...

item.title: Living coral: Pantone's 2019 colour of the year - The Guardian
item.description:
Living coral: Pantone's 2019 colour of the year  The Guardian

The colour of the year comes as a huge relief. I might have predicted sewer-water grey or perhaps the livid yellow of the high-visibility vests worn by France’s gilets jaunes movement, a colour that screams distress like an Edvard Munch painting. From a Britain approaching the black hole of no deal Brexit to Malibu’s ashen burnt-out villas, the hues of these uncanny times must surely be disturbing. Not so, claims Pantone, the authority on colour for the design industry. Today it has announced that the colour of the year for 2019 is a kind of muted terracotta or pastel desert adobe, the sort...

item.title: Sea reefs and sunsets: Living Coral is color of the year - The Associated Press
item.description:
Sea reefs and sunsets: Living Coral is color of the year  The Associated Press

NEW YORK (AP) — It's the color of underwater reefs hanging on for dear life. The sky at dusk. Some of the latest iPhones and the latest looks on the runways of Marc Jacobs and other top fashion designers. Living Coral has been chosen by the Pantone Color Institute as its 2019 color of the year. Can a color be convivial? Laurie Pressman, the company's vice president, considers this saturated orange base with a golden undertone not only warm and welcoming but versatile and life-affirming. It energizes with a softer edge than, say, its pastel and neon color cousins. "With everything that's goi...

item.title: Pantone declares 'living coral' as 2019 color of the year - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

The "living coral" symbolizes "our innate need for optimism and joyful pursuits," said Pantone of its pick for the 2019 color of the year. The US company, an authority in the design industry, explained its decision as a "reaction to the onslaught of the digital technology and social media increasingly embedding into daily life." "We are seeking authentic and immersive experiences that enable connection and intimacy," according to Pantone, adding that the color "encourages lighthearted activity" with its "engaging nature." Of what it looks like, Pantone described the living coral as "an anim...

item.title: A night in Airbnb's greenest apartment - The Telegraph
item.description:
A night in Airbnb's greenest apartment  The Telegraph

Got a touch of the January blues? This (literally) refreshing space may be just what the doctor ordered. Airbnb have teamed up with colour trend-setters extraordinaire Pantone to create “Outside In”, a multi-sensory and achingly hip botanical-themed apartment in central London which you can actually stay in. The colour-matching on the kitchen shelves is meticulous Credit: Ed Reeve/Ed Reeve Hannah pretends this is her front door The house in Clerkenwell is themed around 15-0343 Greenery, Pantone's colour of the year, and Telegraph Travel was the first to spend a night under the fronds. We we...

item.title: Pantone's 2017 Color of the Year is a 'bright and powerful' green - infobae
item.description:
Pantone's 2017 Color of the Year is a 'bright and powerful' green  infobae

The 2017 anointed color, Greenery, a "zesty yellow-green shade that evokes the first days of spring," was announced Thursday. "Greenery bursts forth in 2017 to provide us with the hope we collectively yearn for amid a complex social and political landscape," said the release from Pantone, which provides professional color standards for many industries. No kidding. The design community, paintbrushes and fabric swatches at the ready, was quick with its opinions on the annual color choice. "I am not surprised to see a bright and powerful color this year," said Marika Meyer, a Bethesda designer...

item.title: Color of 2017? Pantone Picks a Spring Shade - The New York Times
item.description:
Color of 2017? Pantone Picks a Spring Shade  The New York Times

When the question of what will define 2017 comes up, the response most often includes words like “Trump” and “populism” and “division” and “anger.” “Green” — not so much. Yet if you believe the team at the Pantone Color Institute, which calls itself the “global color authority,” green will be everywhere in 2017. Not just any old green, of course: Pantone 15-0343, colloquially known as greenery, which is to say a “yellow-green shade that evokes the first days of spring.” That is, the Color of the Year for 2017. Because, though you may not realize it, it turns out that green has everything to...

item.title: Nature and new beginnings inform Pantone’s 2017 color of the year: Greenery - MarketWatch
item.description:
Nature and new beginnings inform Pantone’s 2017 color of the year: Greenery  MarketWatch

By Rachel Koning Beals The tangy yellow-green is a nod to healthier lifestyles and a salve for political wounds Pantone Serenity and Rose Quartz are so out. Greenery, and its supposed promise of rejuvenation in a raw political climate, has been declared 2017’s color of the year. The long-standing arbiter of color trends and standards in design and fashion, Pantone, said the yellow-green Greenery (PANTONE 15-0343) harkens to the fresh foliage and lushness of nature, where individuals are encouraged to oxygenate and reinvigorate. Granny Smith apples spring to mind, as does Kermit the Frog. Wh...

item.title: Will sludge-color packaging deter smokers? - CNN
item.description:
Will sludge-color packaging deter smokers?  CNN

Can the sight of a greenish-brown color really be enough to deter smokers from reaching for their next pack of cigarettes? Lawmakers in the UK hope the "world's ugliest color" will be helpful in lowering smoking rates in their country. In May, previously passed legislation will go into effect requiring all packs of cigarettes to be standardized. Tobaccos products will be stripped of brightly colored branding and replaced with a sludge-like color. But does the stripped-down, "ugly" packaging really reduce smoking? Researchers from the UK and Canada summarized several studies that look at the...

item.title: Zenith's Elite Lady Moonphase Watches Are All About Color - Forbes Now
item.description:
Zenith's Elite Lady Moonphase Watches Are All About Color  Forbes Now

Zenith’s Elite Lady Moonphase in apple green. Summery hues of yellow, apple green, turquoise and red are what Zenith’s new Elite Lady Moonphase models are all about , decorating dials and straps at just the right time and with just the right shade to show off that tan. But these watches offer more than just elegant good looks. Inside beats Zenith’s automatic Elite Caliber 692, with more than 50 hours of power reserve and a moonphase indication that will captivate female mechanical watch lovers. Slim at 3.97mm, the 195-component caliber’s oscillating weight is beautifully decorated with a “C...

item.title: Sira-sira Store: Culinary fashion - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Sira-sira Store: Culinary fashion  Sun.Star Philippines

“GREENERY bursts forth in 2017 to provide us with the reassurance we yearn for amid a tumultuous social and political environment. Satisfying our growing desire to rejuvenate and revitalize, greenery symbolizes the reconnection we seek with nature, one another and a larger purpose.”—Leatrice Eiseman, executive director of the Pantone Color Institute. Eiseman on Pantone’s color of the year—greenery, which is represented by kale. Her words sound prophetic, if we go by the basic meaning of prophecy, which is a message typically involving inspiration, forecast, interpretation or revelation of e...

item.description:

item.title: Pantone's Color of the Year Is Here - Real Living
item.description:
Pantone's Color of the Year Is Here  Real Living

While many expected a light or neutral color to take over next year, Pantone surprised us with a vibrant shade that will surely liven up any area at home. Meet PANTONE 15-0343 Greenery-a pick that perfectly captures our love for plants and the outdoors. IMAGE Pantone Given the recent events happening around the globe, the chosen color is indeed refreshing-a treat to the senses that brings hope for better things to come. "Greenery bursts forth in 2017 to provide us with the hope we collectively yearn for amid a complex social and political landscape. Satisfying our growing desire to rejuvena...

item.title: 4 Ways to Incorporate Greenery Into Your Home - Real Living
item.description:
4 Ways to Incorporate Greenery Into Your Home  Real Living

Every year, stylists, artists, and design enthusiasts look forward to Pantone's official Color of the Year announcement. To say that it's a special time is an understatement as everyone simply can't wait to play with the chosen color-may it be through art, food, and home decor. For 2017, Greenery is the hue of choice-a vibrant and energetic color that reminds us of the beautiful outdoors. If you're just as excited as we are to integrate it into our aesthetic, here are some ideas you can try: 1. Repaint your walls. Reenergize a tired living area by giving your walls a fresh coat of this liv...

item.title: Headstart to 2017: What you need to know - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Headstart to 2017: What you need to know  Sun.Star Philippines

HAPPY New Year and welcome 2017! How’s your year going so far? Now that we’re on another cycle around the sun, here are some of the highlights of the things that you need to know about this New Year for a headstart of what’s to come. 2017 is the year of the Fire Rooster The Rooster Year will officially begin on Chinese New Year which will be on January 28, 2017. Cheers to the Rooster babies! (me lol) Chinese Horoscope calendar says that 2017 is the Female Fire Chicken year. Greenery is Pantone’s color of the year 2017’s color of the year has been announced by Pantone early in December and i...

item.title: Here’s How You Can Wear the 2017 Pantone Color of The Year - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Here’s How You Can Wear the 2017 Pantone Color of The Year  FHM Philippines

Move over, Rose Quartz and Serenity. 2016 is over (finally) and the new Color of The Year has been named. Pantone, the world’s authority in color and the global standard of color communication, has named a Color of The Year annually since 2000. The Color of The Year is, as they describe it, “a symbolic color selection; a color snapshot of what we see taking place in our global culture that serves as an expression of a mood and an attitude.” Of course, as part of encapsulating and directing the spirit of the times, Pantone’s color selection often affects trends in design, pop culture, and fa...

item.title: Prince honored with his own Pantone purple shade - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Prince honored with his own Pantone purple shade  CNN Philippines

(CNN) — The Purple One now has a new shade to call his own. The estate of Prince and the Pantone Color Institute on Monday unveiled a new purple color in honor of the late superstar singer who died last year at the age of 57. Love Symbol #2 is inspired by Prince's custom-made Yamaha purple piano and will be the official color for his brand. Prince pantone purple "The color purple was synonymous with who Prince was and will always be," Troy Carter, entertainment advisor to Prince's estate, said in a statement. "This is an incredible way for his legacy to live on forever." The color purple h...

item.title: How to wear green make-up - and why it's the secret to even skin tone - The Telegraph
item.description:
How to wear green make-up - and why it's the secret to even skin tone  The Telegraph

For beauty lovers world over 2016's Pantone colour of the year was a joy. Rose Quartz in all its shimmering pink glory was complexion friendly, conducive with blush rose cheeks, muted pastel lips and an ethereal glow. This year's hue however, may take a little getting use too. The said shade, titled 'greenery' (#15-0343) is according to the colour chart magnate,'a fresh and zesty yellow-green shade that evokes the first days of spring when nature’s greens revive, restore and renew'. So far, so scary? And yet, a quick glance at the SS17 runways makes it clear that this vivid verdant can b...

item.title: #TBT: 5 Past Colors Of The Year That We Loved - Real Living
item.description:
#TBT: 5 Past Colors Of The Year That We Loved  Real Living

The annual announcement of the Color of the Year has been one of the most anticipated events every year for a couple of reasons. Aside from giving us a peek into what would be on trend in the coming months, the chosen color also helps us plan the look of the home in the New Year. From bold hues to calming shades, we've seen some surprising choices and instant crowd favorites over the years. As we wait for Pantone's official statement on the winning color for 2017, let's revisit some of the unforgettable colors that dominated many homes, stores, and boutiques: 2012: Tangerine Tango IMAGE The...

item.title: Pantone announces new purple shade in honor of Prince - The Guardian
item.description:
Pantone announces new purple shade in honor of Prince  The Guardian

The Pantone Color Institute has announced a new shade of purple in honor of Prince. The new hue has been dubbed Love Symbol #2, after the singer’s logo and custom-made Yamaha purple piano. Throughout Prince’s career, he became indelibly associated with the color, from his album and 1984 film, Purple Rain, to his wardrobe. And Pantone, the standard-bearer for new developments in color intelligence, saw fit to honor the music legend by memorializing the distinct shade. Related: How we made Prince's Purple Rain “We are honored to have worked on the development of Love Symbol #2, a distinctive ...

item.title: Deconstructing A Look From Cynthia Rowley's Fall Winter 2017 Collection - Forbes Now
item.description:
Deconstructing A Look From Cynthia Rowley's Fall Winter 2017 Collection  Forbes Now

A finished collection on the runway has all the pieces for each look in place, working perfectly in harmony. Models ethereally glide by, making it all seem effortless. In reality, every part of the look – the type of fabric, the design, the cut, the mix, the accessories, and the hair and makeup – is carefully created, researched and planned well in advance amid a flurry of activity across international time zones. The deconstruction of this finished look from Cynthia Rowley’s Fall Winter 2017 collection is a great example of a look’s journey from conception to reality (see graphic below)....

item.title: A Brilliantly Simple Solution For Organizing Pantone Color Chips - Fast Company
item.description:
A Brilliantly Simple Solution For Organizing Pantone Color Chips  Fast Company

Pantone‘s chip books are the bible of color for most graphic designers–an indispensable guide to finding the perfect colors. Designers often rip out individual color chips to create mood boards that inform the entire look and feel of a project. [Photo: Chip Slip]But what to do with the ripped-out chips? Instead of taping them back in place or storing them in disorganized envelopes for safekeeping, as many Pantone users do, designer Jesse Reed came up with a custom solution: vinyl pockets perfectly sized for the chips that clip right into Pantone binders. Reed originally launched the Chip Sl...

item.title: Pantone's hot pink is this spring's sizzling interiors trend - The Independent
item.description:
Pantone's hot pink is this spring's sizzling interiors trend  The Independent

Hot pink is the Pantone fashion colour for spring — proving that what goes around comes around. ]]>

item.title: Prince given his own purple shade by Pantone - The Independent
item.description:
Prince given his own purple shade by Pantone  The Independent

Prince is to be honoured with his own official shade of purple by the Pantone Color Institute, it has been announced. Prince was associated with the colour purple throughout his career, from his album Purple Rain to the clothes he wore, and was often referred to as 'the purple one'. Love Symbol #2 is named after the late artist's logo and his custom-made Yamaha piano. The announcement was made a few months after the 30th anniversary deluxe edition of Purple Rain was released. Prince's most iconic looks Laurie Pressman, vice-president of the Pantone Color Institute, said: "We are honoured ot...

item.title: The Trends Of Maison&Objet Paris 2017 - Forbes Now
item.description:
The Trends Of Maison&Objet Paris 2017  Forbes Now

France’s biggest design show, Maison&Objet Paris runs from January 20 to January 24 at Paris Nord Villepinte. Maison&Objet Paris filled eight halls of the venue, dividing them by themes like Cosy, Eclectic, Elegant, Now! Design a Vivre, and Complements. The fair had over 1,000 exhibitors from around the world — showing everything furniture to gifts by exhibitors that ranged from emerging names such as Denmark’s Nordstjerne, which showed its minimal vessels in marble and wood, to iconic design labels like Vitra, which showed several of its classics, such the Uten.Silo wall organizer. Japanes...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S8, Huawei P10, Nokia 3310, Apple: Is Color The New Black - Forbes Now
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S8, Huawei P10, Nokia 3310, Apple: Is Color The New Black  Forbes Now

Huawei’s P10 and P10+ handsets in eight striking colours. Any color, so long as it’s black. Henry Ford’s promise that the Model T only came in the darkest of shades revealed two things: that black has always been popular and that people have always been interested in other colors, too. Not that black isn’t still important. Indeed some people, like Ben Sin, feel black is the bees knees when it comes to phones. This year looks like it’s going to be more colorful than ever. The recently revived Nokia 3310 looks its most exciting in its brightest colors, Warm Red and Yellow. The Nokia 3310 in l...

item.title: Prince's estate files trademark claim for specific shade of purple - The Independent
item.description:
Prince's estate files trademark claim for specific shade of purple  The Independent

The estate of the late musical artist Prince has filed a claim to trademark a particular shade of the colour purple, according to ABC News. If the estate succeeds, producers of films and music could be banned from using that colour without permission. Prince’s company, Paisley Park Enterprises Inc., filed a trademark application for “Love Symbol #2,” which the company Pantone and the Prince estate created in memory of the singer. Love Symbol #2 was meant to be the “official colour across the brand he left behind,” according to Pantone’s statement. - Read more Ava DuVernay to produce new Pri...

item.title: Pantone’s latest colors are the ultimate sign of the times - Fast Company
item.description:
Pantone’s latest colors are the ultimate sign of the times  Fast Company

With the rise of soft, cloth-coated gadgets, it’s become clear that fashion and interior design are impacting consumer electronics. But influence is a two-way street–and the design language of Silicon Valley is also influencing other design sectors. Take Pantone, which is introducing a new slew of colors, called Metallic Shimmers, for a world obsessed shine and shimmer–and where most of us drop $800 on a new phone every two years. Consisting of 200 colors–ranging from more traditional silvers and golds, to more aggressive purple sequin or blue diode–it’s meant as a reference point for anyon...

item.title: Navy Is The New Black In Kitchens And Bathrooms, Design Pros Say - Forbes
item.description:
Navy Is The New Black In Kitchens And Bathrooms, Design Pros Say  Forbes

Every year, paint companies and design industry experts come up with their annual color choices for our homes. Color authority Pantone chose Ultra Violet (Pantone 18-3838) as its 2018 color. Sherwin-Williams named blue-green Oceanside (SW 6496) and Benjamin Moore went another direction altogether with its spicy red Caliente (AF-290). You may paint your walls in one of those colors, or choose towels for your bathroom, but it’s less likely that you’ll buy Caliente cabinets for your master bath renovation or an Ultra Violet dual fuel range from Italy. When a kitchen costs $63,829 to $125,721 ...

item.title: Why millennial pink was no accident - CNN
item.description:
Why millennial pink was no accident  CNN

This article was originally published by Refinery 29, the leading next-gen media and entertainment company focused on women. Tickled pink. Red with rage. Got the blues. Green with envy. Shrinking violet. Color permeates every aspect of our lives but, until recently, fashion had a very long love affair with black. Think of designers' end-of-show bows, when they would emerge onto the catwalk, serious in staid black, a signifier of their focus and dedication to the art they create. Think of industry giants like Diana Vreeland, the Harper's Bazaar and Vogue editor, who favored clothes as black ...

item.title: Crayola’s makeup collaboration: Colorfully fun? - Fast Company
item.description:
Crayola’s makeup collaboration: Colorfully fun?  Fast Company

Crayola is expanding beyond children’s doodles: On Monday, the esteemed crayon brand announced a makeup collaboration with fashion retailer ASOS. The rainbow-bright collection features 58 products with 95 shades, starting at $14.50 for a lip color. With a tongue-in-cheek nod to its crayon roots, there stubby lip colors, highlighters, and other items fashioned like a kindergartner’s art tool. The “Face Crayons” all boast the brand’s signature chevron-striped wrapping and yellow-green packaging. “Cute, right?” reads the product description. “Our inner child is beyond excited. Celebrating indi...

item.title: You Can Now Get Pantone Mood Lighting In Your Car - Fast Company
item.description:
You Can Now Get Pantone Mood Lighting In Your Car  Fast Company

The 2019 Kia K900 is a full-sized sedan stuffed with absurd luxuries. The driver’s seat has a 20-way power adjustment. A 9.7-inch touch screen sits in the dash, controlling a 900-watt, 17-speaker surround sound system. But the most premium touch may actually be the K900’s lighting. Inside the cab, 16 low-wattage LEDs are hidden in the speaker grills, seat backs, and floor consoles, creating a full Pantone-branded atmosphere of color that promises to not interfere with your ability to see the road. [Photo: courtesy Pantone]Using the touch screen, you can choose between 64 colors that light u...

item.title: Color Is Key To Understanding Drama Over Lufthansa's New Branding - Forbes Now
item.description:
Color Is Key To Understanding Drama Over Lufthansa's New Branding  Forbes Now

Bruce Falconer’s lengthy but fascinating story in Sunday’s New York Times magazine takes a look at color. Specifically, Falconer writes about Pantone, the American company that turned an obscure expertise in standardizing shades into a global enterprise and a position as a fashion color king-maker. You won’t see color the same way after reading his story. As an aviation writer, it helped me understand the lingering tempest in the aviation geek community triggered by this month’s unveiling of Lufthansa’s new brand image. The changes were announced by Lufthansa with much fanfare and two airli...

item.title: Utraviolet in the house - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Utraviolet in the house  Sun.Star Philippines

PANTONE is an American company associated with color systems. Don’t ask me more than what I know. Go Google it. Through my fashionista niece Krystalle, I do know that ultraviolet is Pantone’s color for 2018. “You can use the color in small areas in the kitchen, hallway or in table cloths and bed sheets. If your skin tone can stand it, wear it with pride,” Krystalle said. “Can we put it in a mug?” Uncle Gustave asked. “Yes, an ultraviolet mug would be chic,” Krystalle said. “Oh, I was thinking of grape juice,” my uncle replied. After a few seconds, my young nephew Pannon joined us. “I heard ...

item.title: The complicated gender history of pink - CNN
item.description:
The complicated gender history of pink  CNN

This feature is part of Colorscope, an award-winning series exploring our perception of color and its use across cultures, one shade at a time. When you think about the color pink, you are probably conjuring up images of little girls in pink dresses, with pink toys like Barbie or a Disney princess in a pretty gown. The color is overwhelmingly associated with delicacy and femininity. That, however, is a recent development. "If you go back to the 18th century, little boys and little girls of the upper classes both wore pink and blue and other colors uniformly," said Valerie Steele, director o...

item.title: 29 ultraviolet photos that’ll make you fall in love with Pantone’s Color of the Year - 500px
item.description:
29 ultraviolet photos that’ll make you fall in love with Pantone’s Color of the Year  500px

“Ultra Violet” is Pantone’s Color of the Year for 2018. It’s a hue that Pantone has dubbed “inventive and imaginative”, comparing it to far-away galaxies and spiritual expression alike. Get to know the rich, blue-based purple in this collection, curated by 500px’s Production & Photographer Relations Specialist Brian Wilson.

item.title: 5 Fashion Trends To Try This 2018 - Cosmopolitan Philippines
item.description:
5 Fashion Trends To Try This 2018  Cosmopolitan Philippines

It’s January, so you know the drill: Out with the old, in with the new. Here are five global fashion trends you can sport this 2018. - Power Suiting Get with the program. This major trend from the past year will continue to be hot this 2018. Just remember to go for head-to-toe monochrome, stripes, or checkered (another hot print this year), to differentiate it from your office look. Striped blazer P3995, Striped trousers, P1995, Zara - Mixed prints Assorted florals,graphicand checkered prints—this year, you don’t have to pick just one, because mixed prints are in. Mix and match to your hear...

item.title: Know more about the Pantone Color of the Year - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Know more about the Pantone Color of the Year  Sun.Star Philippines

IT IS our year, purple lovers! In the world of fashion and design, Pantone Color of the Year is among the things that is being looked forward to every year. The Pantone Color Institute gives this forecast to guide companies in developing their brand identity and products. For 2018, the group identified “ultra violet” as the newest global color trend. This replaces 2017’s “greenery” which represents the color at the start of spring: a combination of “fresh and zesty” yellow-green. For this year, ultra violet, or what the Pantone website describes as “enigmatic purple,” is said to symbolize t...

item.title: This is the colour every bridesmaid will be wearing in 2018 - The Independent
item.description:
This is the colour every bridesmaid will be wearing in 2018  The Independent

Bridesmaid dresses are notorious for being less than aesthetically-pleasing. The beauty of being a bridesmaid is that you typically have no control over your outfit. Whether the bride wants to dress you up as human cupcake or a fabulously tacky Disney Princess is her choice and, as a sub-par participant in her “special day”, you must accept that you have little sartorial say in the matter. - Read more Bride goes into labour while dancing with her new husband However, if said bride is on top of the latest fashion trends, there’s one colour she’ll definitely have her eye on for her army of ma...

item.title: Ultra violet: Pantone’s 2018 colour of the year - The Guardian
item.description:
Ultra violet: Pantone’s 2018 colour of the year  The Guardian

Pantone describes ultra violet as a “provocative and thoughtful purple shade” that embodies individuality and spirituality. According to the company, it alludes to the mysteries of the cosmos and the unknown. Related: Ultra violet: the colour of 2018 – in pictures Laurie Pressman, vice-president of the Pantone Colour Institute, said: “The Pantone colour of the year has come to mean so much more than ‘what’s trending’ in the world of design; it’s truly a reflection of what’s needed in our world today.” Leatrice Eiseman, executive director of the institute, said: “We are living in a time that...

item.title: A Colorblind Artist? Yes, With a Little Help From His Friends - The New York Times
item.description:
A Colorblind Artist? Yes, With a Little Help From His Friends  The New York Times

Worried that he couldn’t work as an illustrator, Loren Long hid his “obstacle.” Now it’s out in the open.

item.title: To the cosmos and beyond, Pantone’s 2018 color of the year is ... - MarketWatch
item.description:
To the cosmos and beyond, Pantone’s 2018 color of the year is ...  MarketWatch

THE MARGIN By Rachel Koning Beals A ‘thoughtful’ shade of purple, Ultra Violet reflects originality, ingenuity and visionary thinking, says Pantone Pantone Ultra Violet, catalogued 18-3838. Pantone Wildfires torching California, sexual-harassment scandals toppling powerful men and a splintered political landscape — and that’s only a trickle of the headlines. It’s the sludge of earthbound news that has Pantone, the design world’s arbiter of color, looking to the night sky and the future for its 2018 color of the year. Ultra Violet 18-3383, it is — a dramatically provocative and thoughtful sh...

item.title: Pantone Picks 'Ultra Violet' as Color of Year for 2018 - VOA News
item.description:
Pantone Picks 'Ultra Violet' as Color of Year for 2018  VOA News

What we have here in 2017 is a heap of chaos and disruption. What do we need in 2018? The Pantone Color Institute thinks whatever that might be will come in the deep purple hue of "Ultra Violet," its color of the year revealed Thursday. The color wasn't chosen because it's regal, though it resembles a majestic shade. It was chosen to evoke a counterculture flair, a grab for originality, ingenuity and visionary thinking, Pantone Vice President Laurie Pressman told The Associated Press ahead of the announcement. "We are living in complex times," she said. "We're seeing the fear of going forwa...

item.title: The Future Is ... Purple - The New York Times
item.description:
The Future Is ... Purple  The New York Times

Pantone has revealed its color of the year for 2018.

item.title: The Rich and Royal History of Purple, the Color of 2018 - The New York Times
item.description:
The Rich and Royal History of Purple, the Color of 2018  The New York Times

Ultra Violet, Pantone’s color of 2018, is a shade of purple, a hue that signifies power and wealth but with origins in the mucus of sea snails.

item.title: Orange: The color of warmth and comfort - CNN
item.description:
Orange: The color of warmth and comfort  CNN

This feature is part of Colorscope, an award-winning series exploring our perception of color and its use across cultures, one shade at a time. It is the color of fall, of beautiful sunsets, of a warm fireplace in the dreary winters and of marigold flowers. Frank Sinatra called orange the happiest color. Russian artist Wassily Kandinsky described orange as "red brought nearer to humanity by yellow." It is a sacred color in many Eastern religions. Hindu and Buddhist monks wear orange robes, and in Hinduism, orange represents fire and therefore purity; impurities are burned in fire. The word ...

item.title: The Big Money Behind Naming A “Color Of The Year” - Fast Company
item.description:
The Big Money Behind Naming A “Color Of The Year”  Fast Company

How many top colors can you cram into a single year? If paint marketers can be believed, 2018 will be the year of warm greige (Sandstone Tint 441-2DB, by Dutch Boy Paints), midnight blue (Heron 27-18 by Pratt & Lambert), marine teal (Oceanside SW 6496 by Sherwin-Williams), spruce blue-green (In the Moment T18-15 by Behr), and spicy red (Caliente AF-290 by Benjamin Moore). But paint manufacturers aren’t alone in declaring a color of the year (let’s call it “COTY” for short). The concept has spilled across multiple product categories. 2018 will also be the year of Sand Dune (for roofing, by O...

item.description:
How colors change the way we think, feel and consume  CNN

Nanyang Primary School by studio505 and LT&T architects is an eye-catching, colorful extension and rebuild of an existing primary school and kindergarten in Singapore was designed around a generous internal communal space. John Gollings/ courtesy of studio505 and LT&T architects A colorful series of tables "Octahedron Family" by designer Eric Trine, was presented at this year's London Design Festival. london design festival/Eric Trine Pantone's color of 2017, Greenery. pantone Pantone, the company that considers itself an authority on colors in consumer trends, named Rose Quartz and Serenit...

item.title: Scared of Dark Paint? Don’t Be - The New York Times
item.description:
Scared of Dark Paint? Don’t Be  The New York Times

Paint companies are predicting a very dark 2018. But designers say that’s a good thing — and here’s why.

item.title: Red with rage? Green with Envy? Have the blues? - CNN
item.description:
Red with rage? Green with Envy? Have the blues?  CNN

Dr. Sanjay Gupta speaks with the vice president of the Pantone Color Institute about the important role color plays in our everyday lives ©2017 Cable News Network, Inc. A Time Warner Company. All Rights Reserved.
